items.title: The Shutdown Is Over. For Many SNAP Recipients, the Scars Remain.
items.summary: Some recipients have seen their benefits return but are worried they could still be taken away. Others wonder whether the funding could be stopped again at some point.

items.title: N.I.H. Worker Who Criticized Trump Health Policies Says She Is on Administrative Leave
items.summary: The employee, Dr. Jenna Norton, was a key organizer of “The Bethesda Declaration,” a scathing public letter issued in June to Dr. Jay Bhattacharya, the N.I.H. director.

items.title: Republicans Tried to Squelch the Epstein Furor. Instead, They Fed It.
items.summary: A House investigation that the G.O.P. has tried to use to deflect calls for more transparency has yielded striking revelations that have only fueled the Epstein saga.

items.title: California’s Pack Fire Spreads, Forcing Evacuations
items.summary: The Pack fire has grown to 3,400 acres amid high winds, but a coming winter storm might help firefighters control the blaze.

items.title: After 3 Whale Deaths Off British Columbia, Researchers Fear a Pattern
items.summary: A humpback whale known to locals since 2004 was found dead on Nov. 8. Vessel collisions have become a major threat to humpback whales in the region.

items.title: John Beam, Football Coach Who Was Focus of Netflix’s ‘Last Chance U,’ Is Shot
items.summary: The coaching fixture John Beam was gravely wounded in a shooting at Laney College in Oakland, Calif., a commuter school where he is athletic director, according to a city councilman.

items.title: Hegseth announces military operation to remove ‘narco-terrorists from our Hemisphere’– as it happened
items.summary: <p>This live blog is now closed.</p><ul><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/13/trump-news-at-a-glance-latest-updates">Trump news at a glance: president faces potentially damaging congressional vote over releasing Epstein files</a></p></li></ul><p>Democrats appear more enthusiastic than Republicans about voting in next year’s congressional elections following the party’s victories in recent state and local contests, according to a new Reuters/Ipsos poll, which showed Republican President Donald Trump’s approval steady at 40%.</p><p>The six-day poll, which closed on Wednesday, showed 44% of registered voters who called themselves Democrats said they were “very enthusiastic” about voting in the November 3, 2026, elections, compared with 26% of Republicans who said the same. Some 79% of Democrats said they would regret it if they didn’t vote in the election, compared to 68% of Republicans.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/nov/13/donald-trump-jeffrey-epstein-files-us-government-shutdown-latest-news-updates">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: Trump news at a glance: president faces potentially damaging congressional vote over releasing Epstein files
items.summary: <p>Attempts to persuade two female members of Congress to withdraw backing for petition appear to have failed – key US politics stories from Thursday 13 November at a glance</p><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/donaldtrump">Donald Trump</a> is facing the prospect of a politically damaging congressional vote on releasing the <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/jeffrey-epstein">Jeffrey Epstein</a> files after attempts to press two female members of Congress to withdraw their backing for it appeared to have failed.</p><p>The reported refusal of Lauren Boebert, a Republican representative from Colorado, and Nancy Mace, from South Carolina, to remove their names from a discharge petition to force a vote leaves Trump exposed on an issue that carries the possibility of turning segments of his Maga base against him.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/13/trump-news-at-a-glance-latest-updates">Continue reading...</a>
